summary: The document is an identification form associated with the JFK assassination system, dated February 8, 1996. It includes an agent report from March 4, 1971, concerning Henry S. Beer and his step-son, Joachim S. Beer, also known as Joachim F. Pehl. The report details derogatory information uncovered by the Provost Marshal's Office, including incidents involving Joachim F. Beer in 1970 and 1971, such as reports of a fire and disturbing the peace. Originally classified as CONFIDENTIAL, the document was released with deletions on March 9, 1995, with page 42 being regraded as UNCLASSIFIED on October 17, 1994.
key_findings: The document is part of the JFK Assassination System Identification Form.
It contains an agent report from 1971 regarding Henry S. Beer and his step-son Joachim S. Beer.
Derogatory information about Joachim F. Beer includes reports of a fire and disturbing the peace in 1970 and 1971.
The document was classified as CONFIDENTIAL and later released with deletions.
Page 42 of the document was regraded as UNCLASSIFIED in 1994.
